metadata.name: constants.mutation_rarity_weights
metadata.description: ðŸŽ¯ Mutation Rarity Weight Tables
metadata.docstring_full:
ðŸŽ¯ Mutation Rarity Weight Tables

Defines the probability distribution for technique evolution mutations.

Each mutation offer is generated by randomly selecting a rarity
from a weighted table. These weights are affected by the actorâ€™s
current *boost level* for the relevant skill.

Boosts are obtained by spending banked mutations. They increase
the quality of future mutation offers by excluding lower tiers
from the rarity pool.

---

ðŸ“Š Boost Level Effects:

| Boost Level | Eligible Rarities          |
|-------------|-----------------------------|
| 0           | common, uncommon, rare, epic |
| 1           | uncommon, rare, epic         |
| 2           | rare, epic                   |
| 3+          | epic only                    |

Each rarity has a base weight representing its likelihood.

Note: These are NOT player-visible rarity drop rates; they are
internal tuning parameters for the mutation system.

---

definitions.evolution_offer_generator.ge.description: Generate a set of mutation options for a technique based on the given skill.

metadata.name: generate_evolution_offer
metadata.description: Generate a set of mutation options for a technique based on the given skill.
metadata.docstring_full:
Generate a set of mutation options for a technique based on the given skill.
If boost_level > 0, removes lowest rarity tier(s) and adjusts weights accordingly.

Args:
    skill (str): The base skill this offer applies to (e.g. 'sword')
    boost_level (int): 0 (default) = no boost, 1 = skip common, etc.
    current (dict): Existing technique dict to mutate (optional)
    banks (int): If >= 3, includes a boost offer (if not already boosted)

Returns:
    List of dicts, each representing a candidate evolved technique or bank option

definitions.floorplan.description: This module defines the Floorplan structure and creation utilities.

metadata.name: definitions.floorplan
metadata.description: This module defines the Floorplan structure and creation utilities.
metadata.docstring_full:
This module defines the Floorplan structure and creation utilities.
Floorplans are tactical maps composed of dict-based Tiles, each identified by (x, y).

Design Philosophy:
- Tiles are modeled as plain dictionaries to reduce overhead and increase flexibility.
- All relevant tile state is embedded explicitly for clarity and easier serialization.
- Floorplans are maps of arbitrary size, created dynamically as needed.
- This module avoids using classes or object methods to preserve modularity and data transparency.
- Commenting is exhaustive to support learning, maintainability, and extensibility.

definitions.floorplan.create_empty_tile.description: Create a blank tile with default fields.

metadata.name: create_empty_tile
metadata.description: Create a blank tile with default fields.
metadata.docstring_full:
Create a blank tile with default fields.

This function defines the atomic unit of tactical gameplay.
All tiles are assumed to exist in a uniform dict format, with every field explicitly present.
Avoids lazy or implicit defaults to reduce edge-case bugs and enhance testability.

definitions.floorplan.create_floorplan.description: Generate a new floorplan map with initialized tiles.

metadata.name: create_floorplan
metadata.description: Generate a new floorplan map with initialized tiles.
metadata.docstring_full:
Generate a new floorplan map with initialized tiles.

Floorplans are rectangular regions defined by width and height.
Each tile is prepopulated with a clean state to avoid on-demand logic elsewhere.
The floorplan itself is returned as a dict with metadata and tile dictionary.

Args:
    width: Number of tiles in the horizontal direction
    height: Number of tiles in the vertical direction
    map_id: Unique identifier string for the map instance
    seed: Optional integer seed for map-specific RNG or procedural behavior
    label: Human-readable label, used in UI or debug contexts

definitions.floorplan.get_tile.description: Retrieve a tile safely from the floorplan.

metadata.name: get_tile
metadata.description: Retrieve a tile safely from the floorplan.
metadata.docstring_full:
Retrieve a tile safely from the floorplan.

This wrapper protects against direct dictionary access to allow future logic hooks,
validation, or lazy fallback behavior.

Args:
    floorplan: The full floorplan dictionary
    coord: Tuple (x, y) representing the tile location

Returns:
    Tile dictionary at given coordinates, or None if out-of-bounds.

definitions.floorplan.set_tile.description: Overwrite a tile in the floorplan.

metadata.name: set_tile
metadata.description: Overwrite a tile in the floorplan.
metadata.docstring_full:
Overwrite a tile in the floorplan.

Used to inject modified tiles, e.g., after applying damage or building destruction.
No validation is performed â€” it assumes tile_data is well-formed.

Args:
    floorplan: Floorplan dict
    coord: (x, y) coordinate
    tile_data: New tile dict to replace existing entry

definitions.thing.description: THING_DB: Canonical definitions for all placeable or interactable tactical objects.

metadata.name: definitions.thing
metadata.description: THING_DB: Canonical definitions for all placeable or interactable tactical objects.
metadata.docstring_full:
THING_DB: Canonical definitions for all placeable or interactable tactical objects.
These include physical obstacles, props, and devices â€” not environmental effects like fire or fog.

Design Philosophy:
- Only includes tangible objects occupying tile space
- Effects like fog, fire, smoke are stored separately in tile["env"]
- Avoids mixing environmental and interactable state in a single system

Conventions:
- `cover_rating >= 99` is considered full visual block
- `blocks_sight = True` short-circuits line-of-sight
- `destructible = False` means invulnerable
- `flammable = True` can be set on fire by external logic

flow.engine.description: Main game loop and core flow controller.

metadata.name: flow.engine
metadata.description: Main game loop and core flow controller.
metadata.docstring_full:
Main game loop and core flow controller.
This file orchestrates the high-level progression of gameplay phases:
- World entry
- Tactical exploration
- Combat resolution

âš™ï¸ Architectural Philosophy:
- `engine.py` defines flow, not logic.
- All calculations, rules, and simulation updates are offloaded to utils (e.g. combat_utils.py, player_utils.py).
- No embedded string output. All messaging routed through messaging.py or debug_utils.py.
- Tactical and world maps operate as separate layers: engine manages transitions.
- Designed to be modular, testable, and cleanly extensible.

ðŸ“¦ Current Flow Phases (subject to extension):
1. World Entry
2. Tactical Floorplan Load
3. Perception Pass
4. Initiative Queue
5. Actor Turns (player and AI)
6. Cleanup & Effects

This scaffolding will evolve with additional modules and rendering layers, but core responsibility remains orchestration only.

libraries.technique_component_library.description: Component registry for procedural technique generation.

metadata.name: libraries.technique_component_library
metadata.description: Component registry for procedural technique generation.
metadata.docstring_full:
Component registry for procedural technique generation.

Status: Locked
Date: 2025-06-25
Time: 00:00 UTC

All entries in this file are governed by Design Journal entry:
ðŸ“š Technique Component Library â€“ Journal Summary

Components must follow strict schema and are divided by role:
- Triggers: Optional activation conditions
- Effects: Required technique payloads
- Modifiers: Optional conditional modifiers

Each component is a flat dictionary with the following fields:
- id (str): Unique identifier
- type (str): One of 'trigger', 'effect', 'modifier'
- description (str): Human-readable effect
- rare (bool): If True, excluded from base generation
- locked (bool): Must be True unless component is in test or dev state

utils.actor_mutation_utils.apply_mutatio.description: Applies a selected mutation offer to the actor's technique instance.

metadata.name: apply_mutation_to_actor
metadata.description: Applies a selected mutation offer to the actor's technique instance.
metadata.docstring_full:
Applies a selected mutation offer to the actor's technique instance.

Parameters:
    actor: Actor instance
    skill_id: Skill the technique belongs to (e.g., "melee", "sword")
    technique_id: The canonical technique ID (e.g., "piercing_thrust")
    offer: A mutation offer dict, as returned by generate_evolution_offer()

Behavior:
    - Retrieves the actorâ€™s current technique instance
    - Applies the mutation using pure-functional `apply_mutation`
    - Replaces the actorâ€™s stored copy with the mutated result
    - Appends the offer to technique["mutations"] for traceability

This is a pure function: no state is modified.

    technique_id: ID of the technique to mutate

Returns:

        - "type": str
        - "result": new technique dict (or None for 'bank')

utils.cover_utils.description: This module provides utilities for calculating cover and line-of-sight interference

metadata.name: utils.cover_utils
metadata.description: This module provides utilities for calculating cover and line-of-sight interference
metadata.docstring_full:
This module provides utilities for calculating cover and line-of-sight interference
from things located on tactical tiles. Cover is determined by the presence of objects
with defined cover_rating or blocks_sight attributes.

Design Philosophy:
- Cover and visibility are tile-centric but determined by objects ('things')
- Modular: Does not assume or enforce actor/team logic
- Lightweight: Only operates on floorplan and things, does not invoke perception or combat systems

Dependencies:
- floorplan.get_tile(x, y): returns tile at (x, y)
- Each tile: tile["things"] is a list of dicts representing things
- Each thing may define: "cover_rating": int, "blocks_sight": bool

Output:
- calculate_cover_between returns list of cover-relevant things, with positions
- Can be used by perception, combat, AI modules

utils.cover_utils.get_cover_objects_alon.description: Scans the tiles along the given path and returns all objects that influence cover.

metadata.name: get_cover_objects_along_path
metadata.description: Scans the tiles along the given path and returns all objects that influence cover.
metadata.docstring_full:
Scans the tiles along the given path and returns all objects that influence cover.

Args:
    path (List[Tuple[int, int]]): List of (x, y) positions from observer to target
    floorplan (Dict): Dict of (x, y): tile

Returns:
    List[Dict]: List of {"pos": (x, y), "thing": <thing dict>} entries that affect cover

utils.cover_utils.calculate_total_cover.description: Computes the total cover_rating from objects along the path.

metadata.name: calculate_total_cover
metadata.description: Computes the total cover_rating from objects along the path.
metadata.docstring_full:
Computes the total cover_rating from objects along the path.
Ignores cover that is at the source or destination.

Args:
    path (List[Tuple[int, int]]): Ordered list from observer to target (inclusive)
    floorplan (Dict): Tactical map of tiles

Returns:
    int: Total cover penalty from all intervening things

utils.general_utils.trace_line.description: Traces a straight line from `start` to `end` using a grid-based algorithm.

metadata.name: trace_line
metadata.description: Traces a straight line from `start` to `end` using a grid-based algorithm.
metadata.docstring_full:
Traces a straight line from `start` to `end` using a grid-based algorithm.
Returns a list of dicts, one for each tile crossed, including blocking status.

This function does NOT interpret what counts as blocking â€” it marks the presence
of potentially blocking features (terrain, things), but leaves interpretation
to the caller.

Parameters:
    - start: origin (x, y)
    - end: destination (x, y)
    - floorplan: map of (x, y) to tile dict
    - stop_at_block: if True, halts trace when blocking tile is encountered

Design constraints:
- No side effects (pure function)
- Supports cardinal and diagonal directions
- Does not skip corners
- Assumes floorplan is prevalidated and includes full tile data for every coord

utils.general_utils.compute_visibility_p.description: Given a traced path from `trace_line`, compute the cumulative visibility penalty

metadata.name: compute_visibility_penalty_along_path
metadata.description: Given a traced path from `trace_line`, compute the cumulative visibility penalty
metadata.docstring_full:
Given a traced path from `trace_line`, compute the cumulative visibility penalty
from all environmental effects (e.g. fog, smoke, fire) on traversed tiles.

This function does not alter the path or interpret vision outcomes â€” it merely
returns the total penalty value for further evaluation.

metadata.name: bresenham_line
metadata.description: Bresenham's line algorithm (integer-based, grid-safe)
metadata.docstring_full: Bresenham's line algorithm (integer-based, grid-safe)

utils.movement_utils.move_actor_to_zone.description: ðŸš¶ Low-level zone transition function. Moves an actor from their current

metadata.name: move_actor_to_zone
metadata.description: ðŸš¶ Low-level zone transition function. Moves an actor from their current
metadata.docstring_full:
ðŸš¶ Low-level zone transition function. Moves an actor from their current
zone to an *adjacent* zone, with full validation.

This is the core atomic movement step, and is used by all higher-level
movement logic. It ensures:
- The destination zone is adjacent to the current one
- The actor is removed from the old zone and added to the new one
- The actor's `current_zone` reference is updated

Parameters:
- actor: any object with `.name` and `.current_zone`
- destination_zone: Zone object

Returns:
- True if move succeeds
- False if destination is not adjacent

utils.movement_utils.get_zone_by_feature.description: Resolves a string like "broken pillar" or "pile of crates"

metadata.name: get_zone_by_feature
metadata.description: Resolves a string like "broken pillar" or "pile of crates"
metadata.docstring_full:
Resolves a string like "broken pillar" or "pile of crates"
to the first Zone in the room that contains that feature.

Parameters:
- room: Room object containing zones
- feature_string: exact string to match in zone.features

Returns:
- Zone object if found
- None if not found

utils.movement_utils.resolve_target_to_z.description: Resolves any navigation target to a Zone.

metadata.name: resolve_target_to_zone
metadata.description: Resolves any navigation target to a Zone.
metadata.docstring_full:
Resolves any navigation target to a Zone.

Accepted target types:
- str: treated as a feature name
- any object with `.current_zone`: treated as an actor

Parameters:
- target: str or actor object
- room: Room object used for feature resolution

Returns:
- Zone object or None

utils.movement_utils.find_path_between_z.description: Returns a list of zones connecting start_zone to target_zone

metadata.name: find_path_between_zones
metadata.description: Returns a list of zones connecting start_zone to target_zone
metadata.docstring_full:
Returns a list of zones connecting start_zone to target_zone
using breadth-first search.

This allows navigation across multi-zone rooms based on connectivity.

Returns:
- List of Zone objects [start, ..., target]
- Empty list if no valid path exists

utils.movement_utils.distance_between_zo.description: Returns the number of hops between two zones using breadth-first search.

metadata.name: distance_between_zones
metadata.description: Returns the number of hops between two zones using breadth-first search.
metadata.docstring_full:
Returns the number of hops between two zones using breadth-first search.
If no path exists (e.g. blocked or disconnected), returns None.

metadata.name: move_actor_toward_target
metadata.description: Generalized movement function that handles:
metadata.docstring_full:
Generalized movement function that handles:
- Moving toward a feature (str)
- Moving toward another actor

It resolves the target to a destination zone, computes the shortest
path from the actor's current zone, and moves one step toward it.

This enables natural language-style inputs:
- "move to pile of crates"
- "approach the automaton"

Movement is only one step per call to enforce tactical pacing.

Parameters:
- actor: object with .name and .current_zone
- room: Room object the actor is in
- target: str (feature) or object with .current_zone

Returns:
- True if movement occurred
- False if move invalid, unreachable, or already there

utils.movement_utils.start_movement_to_t.description: Initializes multi-turn movement toward a feature or actor.

metadata.name: start_movement_to_target
metadata.description: Initializes multi-turn movement toward a feature or actor.
metadata.docstring_full:
Initializes multi-turn movement toward a feature or actor.
Stores the zone path in actor.movement_path.

This replaces immediate movement â€” nothing happens this turn,
but actor is now committed to a path.

Parameters:
- actor: actor object
- room: the current Room
- target: feature string or another actor

Returns:
- True if movement path created
- False if target invalid or unreachable

utils.movement_utils.advance_actor_movem.description: Advances movement along actor's movement_path by one turn.

metadata.name: advance_actor_movement
metadata.description: Advances movement along actor's movement_path by one turn.
metadata.docstring_full:
Advances movement along actor's movement_path by one turn.
- Adds 1 to progress
- Moves to next zone when cost is met
- Resets progress
- Continues until path is empty

Returns:
- True if actor moved to a new zone this turn
- False if still progressing or path empty

utils.technique_mutation_utils.generate_.description: Given a technique dict, returns 4 possible evolution choices:

metadata.name: generate_evolution_offer
metadata.description: Given a technique dict, returns 4 possible evolution choices:
metadata.docstring_full:
Given a technique dict, returns 4 possible evolution choices:
- Add effect (if legal)
- Replace effect
- Change modifier (if any)
- Bank offer

The rarity parameter influences the subcomponent weights.

utils.technique_mutation_utils.apply_mut.description: Applies the selected mutation offer to the base technique.

metadata.name: apply_mutation
metadata.description: Applies the selected mutation offer to the base technique.
metadata.docstring_full:
Applies the selected mutation offer to the base technique.

Arguments:
    base_technique: The original technique dict before mutation.
    offer: A dict containing keys:
        - "type": One of "replace_effect", "add_effect", "change_modifier", "bank"
        - "result": The precomputed result technique (except for "bank")

Returns:
    A new technique dict reflecting the chosen mutation.
    If type == "bank", returns the original technique unchanged.

utils.technique_utils.get_available_muta.description: Returns a list of valid mutation types for a given technique.

metadata.name: get_available_mutations
metadata.description: Returns a list of valid mutation types for a given technique.
metadata.docstring_full:
Returns a list of valid mutation types for a given technique.

Ensures we do not suggest evolutions that would exceed field limits
or create invalid states. Used by the mutation offer generator.

Possible mutations:
- "replace_effect": always allowed if any effect exists
- "add_effect": allowed if len(effects) < 2
- "add_modifier": only allowed if modifier is None

utils.visibility_utils.visual_coverage.description: Estimate how much of the target zone is visible from the observer.

metadata.name: visual_coverage
metadata.description: Estimate how much of the target zone is visible from the observer.
metadata.docstring_full:
Estimate how much of the target zone is visible from the observer.
Uses number of blocking zones along the visibility path as a proxy for visual obstruction.

Returns a float between 0.0 and 1.0:
- >= 0.9 â†’ clear visibility
- >= 0.3 â†’ vague
- < 0.3 â†’ unseen

metadata.name: observe
metadata.description: Perception scan with:
metadata.docstring_full:
Perception scan with:
- Light-based visibility caps
- Vague fallback awareness
- Tiered resolution: clear, vague, or unknown

utils.visibility_utils.trace_visibility_.description: Returns the list of intermediate zones (excluding origin and target)

metadata.name: trace_visibility_path
metadata.description: Returns the list of intermediate zones (excluding origin and target)
metadata.docstring_full:
Returns the list of intermediate zones (excluding origin and target)
along the shortest line-of-vision path between origin and target.
This is a vision-safe BFS path that ignores movement-specific obstacles.

If no path is found (e.g. disconnected zones), returns None.

world.hex.HexTile.description: Represents a single tile in the axial world coordinate system (q, r).

metadata.name: HexTile
metadata.description: Represents a single tile in the axial world coordinate system (q, r).
metadata.docstring_full:
Represents a single tile in the axial world coordinate system (q, r).
Intended to serve as a foundational unit in overworld travel and terrain logic.

Fields:
- q, r: axial coordinates
- seed: tile-specific generation seed
- biome_tag, elevation, moisture: terrain properties
- terrain_tags: arbitrary feature tags
- hinted_features: placeholder for future map features
- location_stub: optional undiscovered structure reference
- faction_influence_estimates: placeholder for strategic layer

Returns:
    int: reproducible seed based on (q, r)
